# prepareContent()

**Instance Method**

Typically overridden by subclasses that require additional control over the creation of new objects.

## Declaration

```swift
func prepareContent()
```

## Discussion

Subclasses that implement this method are responsible for creating the new content object and setting it as the receiver’s content object. This method is only called if [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSObjectController/automaticallyPreparesContent] has been set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Managing content

- **content**: The receiver’s content object.
- **automaticallyPreparesContent**: A Boolean that shows whether the receiver automatically creates and inserts new content objects automatically when loading from a nib file.
